Windows 8 development: xaml controls

08 January 2015

Overview

Windows 8.1 use the MVVM pattern for their apps. For their View, they use xaml, this post is about the different types of xaml controls. More information can be found here.

Examples

 1 <!-- Button control with Click event -->
 2 <Button x:Name="myButton" Click="myButton_Click" />
 3 
 4 <!-- Acts like an html table -->
 5 <Grid />
 6 
 7 <!-- Holds <ColumnDefinition> controls, lives in Grid -->
 8 <Grid.ColumnDefinitions></Grid.ColumnDefinitions>
 9 
10 <!-- Holds <RowDefinition> controls, lives in Grid -->
11 <Grid.RowDefinitions></Grid.RowDefinitions>
12 
13 <!-- Rectangle -->
14 <Rectangle Fill="Blue" Height="100" Width="100" />
15 
16 <!-- acts like a stack of controls (like floating left or top in case of Vertical orientation) -->
17 <StackPanel Orientation="Horizontal" />
18 
19 <!-- holds text, if needs to be in Grid iff assigned grid properties -->
20 <TextBlock Grid.Row="0" />
